content.title: Pre-Matric Scholarships to the Children of Those Engaged in Occupations Involving Cleaning and Prone to Health Hazards
content.department: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
content.beneficiary: Children of those engaged in occupations involving cleaning and prone to health hazards
content.details: Launched in the year 1977-78, the scheme aims to provide financial assistance to children whose parents/guardians belong to categories such as Tanners, Flayers, Waste Pickers, and Persons engaged in Manual Scavenging.
benefits: Day Scholars: ₹ 110/- per month for ten months.
Hostellers: ₹ 700/- per month for ten months.
Ad-Hoc Grant: ₹ 750/- per student per annum for day scholars and ₹ 1000/- per student per annum for hostellers.
Additional provisions for students with disabilities including reader allowance, transport allowance, special pay, escort allowance, and extra coaching allowance.
eligibility: Children/wards of Indian Nationals belonging to Tanners & Flayers, Waste Pickers, Manual Scavengers, and those engaged in hazardous cleaning.
Students must not take up employment during their studies.
Scholarship may be discontinued if a student fails to secure annual promotion.
exclusions: Students benefiting from this scheme cannot avail of benefits under any other pre-matric scholarship scheme.
documents_required: Bank Details of the Aadhaar-linked Bank Account
Certificate from the District Social Welfare Officer proving that at least one parent is engaged in eligible occupations.

faqs.question: What role do schools play in assisting students with scholarship applications?
faqs.answer: Schools are expected to provide full support to students in submitting their scholarship applications and coordinating with the State Government and NSKFDC.

faqs.question: How is the scheme announced, and how can students apply for it?
faqs.answer: The scheme is announced by the State Government/Union Territory Administration through advertisements in newspapers, and application forms are supplied by the concerned department.

faqs.question: Can you explain the duration and course of studies covered by the scholarship?
faqs.answer: The scholarship applies to students in class I or subsequent classes for day scholars and class III or subsequent classes for hostellers. It terminates at the end of class X.

faqs.question: How is the scholarship disbursed?
faqs.answer: The scholarship amount is paid from the date of joining to the date of leaving school, excluding vacation periods, and is typically disbursed through Direct Benefit Transfer (DBT).

faqs.question: What qualifies as a disability for this scholarship?
faqs.answer: Disabilities are defined by the Persons with Disabilities Act and include conditions like blindness, low-vision, leprosy-cured, hearing impairment, locomotor disability, mental retardation, and mental illness.
